1.text: Crack 4 large eggs into a large bowl.

2.text: Add milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon to the bowl.

3.text: Beat the mixture together with a fork or whisk.

4.text: Add flour to thicken the batter and make fluffier toast, if desired.

5.text: Place a cast-iron pan on the burner, if you are using a stove.

6.text: Add 1 tablespoon (15 mL) butter or spray the pan with nonstick spray.

7.text: Set the stove to medium high heat or heat your griddle to 350 °F (177 °C).

8.text: Turn the heat down to medium-low once the butter melts.

9.text: Coat 2 slices of bread at a time with the egg mixture.

10.text: Place each coated slice of bread into the hot pan.

11.text: Cook the toast for 1 to 4 minutes on each side, or until golden.

12.text: Place the French toast on a serving plate straight from the pan.

13.text: Try ricotta cheese for a more savory option.

14.text: Add a fruity topping to add some flavor.

15.text: Sprinkle on cinnamon or powdered sugar.

16.text: Spread some chocolate on the toast.

17.text: Drizzle syrup on the toast for a classic breakfast flavor.
